alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Franklin and east central St. Lawrence Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Ozonia, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to locally heavy rain is falling in a slow-moving shower where flooding was reported this morning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on road surfaces may lead to conditions where hydroplaning could occur. Area creeks, streams, and rivers are running faster than usual and may be approaching thier banks. Any standing water that has not yet receded may temporarily rise again due to new rainfall before falling again. Locations impacted include... Lake Ozonia, Hopkinton, St. Regis Falls, Nicholville and Dickinson Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence
